page.title: 13Tourism at Chatsworth
page.content: The B6012 public road runs parallel to the River Derwent almost through the centre of Chatsworth Park. From the highest point on this road there is an excellent view of the House. There is an age-old tradition of free access to the Park and woodland surrounding Chatsworth. The principal Estate village of Edensor lies to the west of the House within the Park. Built as a model village in the mid-nineteenth century, it has a fine Church, a Post Office and a Tea Room and provides housing for Estate employees and pensioners. Pilsley village further north is also an Estate village with its own school,Post Office and Public House. The Chatsworth Farm Shop and five retail workshops provide local employment and an additional tourist attraction.
